comments:
PulsePlay is a thoughtful and well-executed project that blends machine learning and mental health benefits through music. One key strength is its personalization: by tapping into users’ own Spotify data and allowing emotional input, it addresses the frustration of generic playlists effectively. However, there are several areas where the project could be improved.

From a technical perspective, exploring more advanced or hybrid models like ensemble learning or deep learning (e.g., random forest or neural nets) might improve accuracy further. Including explainable AI components would allow users to understand why a song matches their mood, building more trust in the system.

On the entrepreneurship side, the project could benefit from identifying a target market (e.g., Spotify premium users, mental wellness platforms) and suggesting a business model—freemium, SaaS plugin, or partnerships with therapists/music therapists. Finally, including data privacy handling measures (especially since Spotify data is used) would strengthen trust and potential real-world deployment.

Overall, PulsePlay is a solid and practical solution with strong emotional resonance. With more strategic polish and future roadmap clarity, it could stand out as both a useful tool and a scalable product.
project_name: PulsePlay

comments:
This concept is technically feasible and scientifically valuable. Raspberry Pi is a cost-effective and flexible platform for automation and imaging tasks. Combining it with water quality sensors and imaging tools can create a powerful system for real-time monitoring and analysis of duckweed growth under various conditions.
Benefits:
High-Throughput Imaging - Enables visual tracking of duckweed growth across multiple samples simultaneously.
Non-Laborious Monitoring - Reduces manual effort in data collection, freeing up researchers for analysis and hypothesis testing.
Integration with Water Quality Data - Correlating growth patterns with water parameters (e.g., pH, turbidity, nutrient levels) enhances understanding of duckweed physiology and environmental responses.
Portable and Scalable - Raspberry Pi makes the system affordable and deployable in field or lab settings.
Open-Source Potential - Can be shared with the research community for collaborative development and standardization.

Downside:
Imaging Limitations -Raspberry Pi cameras may have limited resolution or lighting control, affecting image quality and analysis accuracy.
Environmental Variability - Outdoor deployments may face challenges like lighting changes, water movement, or contamination.
Data Storage & Processing - High-frequency imaging and sensor data can generate large datasets, requiring robust storage and processing solutions.
Calibration & Maintenance - Sensors and cameras need regular calibration to ensure data reliability.
Software Complexity - Developing a seamless interface between imaging, sensor data, and analysis tools may require advanced programming and machine learning expertise.
Low entrepreneurial options - does not have strong monetization model and limited customers.
project_name: Integrating Water Quality Monitoring with Duckweed Image Analysis

comments:
This concept is technically feasible and socially impactful. Many cities are already experimenting with AI-driven transit solutions, and SmartCommute’s use of Enhanced LSTM models, SVR, and GTFS APIs shows a strong foundation in both machine learning and real-time data integration.
Benefits:
Accurate ETA Predictions
Reduced Waiting Times
A 40% reduction is ambitious but achievable with high-quality data and consistent updates.
Advanced Schedule Planning
Allows users to plan trips ahead, improving time management and reducing stress.
Location-Based Bus Stop Finder
Improves accessibility for unfamiliar routes or tourists.
Personalized Interfaces
Senior-friendly design and accessibility options promote inclusivity.
Automated Reminders & Notifications
Keeps users informed about delays, arrivals, and schedule changes.
Data Visualization Dashboard
Useful for both commuters and transit authorities to monitor performance and usage.
Sustainability Impact
Encourages public transport use, reducing carbon footprint and traffic congestion.

Downside:
Data Dependency
Accuracy relies heavily on the quality and frequency of Realtime data and GPS signals. Inconsistent data can degrade performance.
Model Complexity & Maintenance
May require regular retraining and tuning, which can be resource-intensive.
Battery & Data Usage
Real-time tracking and notifications may consume significant battery and mobile data.
Privacy Concerns
Location tracking and personalized features must comply with data protection regulations (e.g., PDPA in Malaysia, GDPR if expanded globally).
Integration Challenges
Coordinating with multiple transit agencies and ensuring API compatibility can be complex.
User Adoption
Success depends on user trust and ease of use. A steep learning curve or technical glitches could hinder adoption.
project_name: SmartCommute: Predictive ETA for Seamless Public Transport

comments:
Personal safety is a highly relevant topic. The app addresses a real problem with a solution that could genuinely help users in distress. Using Flutter for cross-platform development is a smart choice to maximize reach. Firebase integration (Auth & Firestore) shows good backend knowledge and ensures scalability and secure data handling. Accelerometer-based shake detection is an innovative and intuitive SOS trigger. All and all, the application has well-rounded features like real-time location sharing and automated alerts.

For presentation wise, the description is clear, concise, and well-structured. The functionality is easy to understand and compelling. Nitpick: Some of the "slides" are too wordy, probably can put more picture to visualize the messages instead of reading through the paragraphs.

Some considerations for future improvement
- Security & Privacy Considerations: How is user data protected, especially location and contact info? Some encryption or data handling policies would strengthen the case.
- False Positives & Calibration: How do you avoid accidental shake detections?
- Offline Functionality: Can any part of the app function offline or with limited connectivity? What happens if there’s no data but SMS is available (or vice versa)?

Overall, this is an impressive and thoughtful project with excellent potential for real-world impact. It demonstrates a solid command of both mobile app development and cloud services, while addressing a socially valuable problem. Great work!
project_name: SafeGuard: Personal Safety and Emergency Response App

comments:
(Pros)
You gains direct, hands-on experience with core web technologies like HTTP/HTTPS protocols, network requests, and how to analyze server responses with localthos. This builds a strong understanding of web communications and security headers from the ground up. Second, it creates a controlled environment. Building locally means safe experimentation without impacting live websites. This predictability is ideal for debugging and validating the checker's logic against known setups, ensuring accuracy in its core functions. Lastly, it's cost-effective. 
(Cons)
However, the localhost simulation presents key limitations. The most critical is the lack of real-world accuracy. Scanning from local machine doesn't reflect actual internet conditions like network latency or global server locations. This creates a "self-claim" issue, where results aren't truly representative of public websites. Additionally, it leads to limited scope. You can't test against diverse server configurations or simulate scans from different geographical regions, which are vital for a comprehensive web checker. Lastly, there's the perception of "reinventing the wheel." Without a unique approach, the project might appear to simply duplicate features already available in mature tools like Qualys SSL Labs or GTmetrix.

Key Improvements 

 * Deploy to Public Server: The most impactful step is to host the checker on a low-cost cloud service (e.g., AWS, Vercel) to scan real, public websites. This directly addresses the "self-claim" issue 
 * Deepen Analysis: Enhance the checks. For SSL/TLS, analyze cipher suites and certificate chains. For HTTP Security Headers, provide granular feedback and assign a security score. For open ports, identify services and explain specific risks.
 * Enhance User Interface: Implement pagination and search for the scan history. Introduce a clear, weighted ranking or score for scan results, providing an instant visual indicator of a website's security posture.
 * Incorporate Risk Analysis: Categorize findings (e.g., High, Medium, Low risk) and, crucially, provide actionable remediation steps
project_name: Web Checker: Website Information Discovery

Furthermore, the candidate utilised VueJS for frontend. This has demonstrated the candidate is able to use page navigation, api call, form validation, and data display. This demostrates the candidate is able to use reusable components, employed a user-friendly, datatable and dialog-based form, demonstrating the candidate's proficiency in crafting a seamless UI/UX experience. 
The dashboard showcases an analytics display that presents the overall order data, demonstrating the candidate's ability to write queries using database statements. 
While the system is functional, adding email notifications, invoice/receipt generation, a sandbox ePayment gateway, and live car market prices would further enrich its capabilities. Overall, the candidate has effectively demonstrated their skills in developing a robust and user-friendly Fleet Management System.

comments:
1. The presentation slides could benefit from significant improvement. There is an inconsistent use of font families, and the slides are overly text-heavy, lacking visual aids or illustrations to support understanding. Improving the visual hierarchy and integrating graphics would enhance clarity and engagement.

2. The system interface design requires refinement. For instance, action buttons such as Add, Delete, and Statistical Report are placed too closely together, creating a cluttered appearance. On the list page, the action buttons are misaligned, with “Details” and “Edit” on top and “Delete” positioned separately at the bottom, thus causing visual imbalance. Additionally, using the same color scheme for both action buttons and table header buttons leads to confusion. A clearer separation in layout and design would improve user experience.

3. There are issues with inconsistent capitalization in dropdown options, and misalignment of label text, which affect the overall polish and professionalism of the interface. Consistency in UI elements plays a key role in user trust and ease of use.

4. The process of entering data into the system is overly complicated and time-consuming. The number of steps required may discourage users from continuing to use the system, especially during initial onboarding. Streamlining the workflow and reducing unnecessary steps would significantly enhance usability and adoption.

comments:
Your project offers a conceptually strong solution that will greatly improve digital accessibility for older people, which is a very important goal. The modular design, which includes several AI-powered features like issue detection and smart navigation, shows that the problem was thought about carefully. It would be helpful to go into more detail about the technical details of your solution, especially the training and testing methods for your self-trained CNN model and the exact role of your database. This would make your solution even stronger. Also, telling a more coherent story about the whole user journey would make it clearer how all of these new features work together for the end user.

Your idea for UNCLE as an add-on solution is great because it fills a need in a big and growing market. You've also shown that you can think ahead by giving high-level revenue projections and a release schedule. But for UNCLE to be commercially viable, a lot depends on solving real-world design problems. To make sure the solution can handle a lot of users and different types of real-world websites in the future, it's important to come up with a strong plan for scaling it. This plan should include all the technical details of how to integrate it and handle the computational load. A more detailed go-to-market plan with clear customer acquisition channels and a clear pricing model with the assumptions behind it would make your path as an entrepreneur even stronger. If these practical and technical issues are handled well, UNCLE's chances of making money and being adopted by the market will go up a lot.

I have enjoyed your great presentation. The presentation was engaging and clear. It demonstrates your knowledge on the topic and how confident you are in yourself and your project. Keep innovating!
project_name: Universal Navigation & Customisation for Learning Elderly

comments:
project demonstrates an impressive solution, the problem statement and scope are not well framed. It is essential to clearly define the specific issue you aim to address and breadth of project's objectives. A well-articulated problem statement and scope not only provide context but also set the foundation for evaluating the relevance and effectiveness of the solution.
The solution indeed appears promising, showcasing potential to address the intended problem effectively. However, there is a noticeable lack of detailed information regarding how the solution was achieved. For instance, the specifics of the machine learning model used are not mentioned. It is crucial to include details about the ML model selection, the rationale behind choosing a particular model, and how it was trained and validated. This information is vital for understanding the robustness and reliability of the solution.
The architecture and system flow presented appear to be at a high level, lacking in-depth explanations of the components and their interactions. A more detailed architectural description would enhance the clarity and comprehensiveness of the project. It is important to illustrate how different modules of the system interact, the data flow, and the overall structure that supports the solution. Such detailed documentation helps in evaluating the feasibility and scalability of the system.
Despite these gaps, the system development and the final solution are satisfactory. The project shows potential and indicates a competent execution of the core idea. However, to transform this project into a fully operational and credible model, it is essential to include detailed workflows and methodologies. A clear depiction of the methodologies used, including data preprocessing steps, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation processes, would significantly enhance the project's credibility and provide a complete picture of the solution.
In conclusion, while the project exhibits promise and technical competence, there is a need for more detailed documentation and clarification of the methodologies and processes involved. By addressing the issues related to the framing of the problem statement and scope, providing detailed information on the ML model used, and elaborating on the system architecture and flow, this project can be elevated to a higher level of excellence. I encourage incorporating these elements to create a more robust and transparent working model.
project_name: SMART INTEGRATED CONTROL SYSTEM FOR THE PYROLYSIS PROCESS

comments:
The project addresses an important foundational skill — learning to read clocks — and presents it through an interactive and engaging application. The use of adaptive learning through machine learning and gamified features is a good attempt to enhance user engagement.

However, the need for a clock learning app in today’s context is debatable, given the wide availability of similar apps and the reduced emphasis on analog clocks among younger generations. As such, the practical and entrepreneurial opportunities appear limited unless the project can identify a unique differentiator or solve a current gap in existing solutions (e.g., accessibility, local language support, or integration into national curriculums).

Additionally, the presentation lacked clarity in system architecture and solution design — more technical depth on how the recommendation system works, data flow, and scalability considerations would have strengthened the overall quality and seriousness of the solution.

To improve, the team should focus on:

Identifying what makes their app stand out from existing ones.

Demonstrating a clear architectural design and deployment model.

Exploring potential use cases beyond just time-telling — perhaps expanding into a broader early math education platform.
project_name: Clock Learning App for Children

comments:
Good idea with some level of originality.

Several problems with the solution:
1) There is a very good reason why most of the finance/budgeting tools are available in mobile app format - ease of access, being able to record down the money you spend on the spot instead of having to look for Internet connection, access a website, login, look for the record function greatly improve user experience.

2) Admin account is not needed at all, user management can be done on database management system itself, bill type function can actually be included in user account to let user customize their own list or have a fixed list instead.

3) Project budget tracking is an interesting idea, but the implementation is weird. It should be a short term goal to encourage user to save a portion of their income from that point of time onward, instead, the application uses the past incomes and expenses as the base data, does that means it is encouraging the user to spend all of his/her saving once they hit the goal? Also, the progress bar for each record in the budget tracking function is confusing, it is calculated using the income/expense divided by the goal, this information provides no value to the user.

4) The Income management and Expense management function are separated but why are they sharing the bill type drop down?

5) Consider to only include monthly incomes and expenses instead of every data point of the user for State Analysis so user can track improvement on spending habit. Notification could be shown when user is recording expenses instead of only showing when user choose the State Analysis function.

Financial knowledge sharing module is a great addition in a personal financial management system.
project_name: Personal Financial Management System

comments:
The project introduces ReGazeVR, a virtual reality-based rehabilitation game intended to support stroke patients experiencing eye-tracking difficulties. The concept is to deliver clinically inspired visual exercises in an engaging 3D environment using gaze-based interaction. It claims to support home-based therapy with real-time tracking, progress monitoring via Firebase, and remote therapist supervision—all of which are promising in terms of accessibility and scalability, particularly for rural or mobility-limited users.

However, after watching the presentation, it was difficult to determine the actual progress of the development. Much of the video seemed to rely on general internet content rather than showing concrete implementation or original development work. Key aspects like demo walkthroughs, interface design, or user testing were missing or unclear. This raises questions about whether the team has a working prototype or if the project remains mostly at a conceptual level.

In addition, the idea itself is not entirely novel. Similar VR rehabilitation tools for visual and motor therapy already exist, and even the GitHub link https://github.com/DidStuffStudio/ReGaze/tree/main seems closely related or possibly reused. This affects the originality of the work, unless the team can clearly demonstrate what new contributions they have made beyond existing solutions.

Overall, while the problem being addressed is meaningful and the proposed approach aligns with current trends in digital health, the project lacks clarity on implementation and differentiation. For future presentations, it would help to show hands-on development, specific technical contributions, and how this version improves or builds upon existing work.
project_name: Virtual Reality (VR) Game on Eye Tracking Rehabilitation for Stroke Patient

comments:
Real-Route is a real-time route optimization system that aims to alleviate urban congestion and improve mobility using Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) communication and adaptive route optimization algorithms. Unlike typical navigation apps that rely heavily on crowdsourced data, Real-Route utilizes direct inputs from roadside units (RSUs) and connected vehicles, enabling more accurate and timely traffic predictions. The system includes both a mobile application for drivers and a dashboard for traffic managers, allowing multi-level interaction—from individual guidance to city-wide mobility oversight.

The system is well-conceived, aligning with smart city, sustainability, and Industry 4.0 trends. The dual-interface approach (public + operator) is commendable and demonstrates foresight for real-world applications across logistics, urban commuting, and even autonomous systems. The claim of scalability and flexibility is theoretically sound.

However, despite the strong vision, the innovative execution is limited at the FYP level. V2X infrastructure is still sparse in most regions, and there’s no indication that this project is integrated with actual RSUs or live vehicle feeds. Instead, it appears to rely on simulated or static data, which limits the real-time intelligence it claims to deliver. The adaptive routing algorithm is not described in detail, raising questions about whether it’s genuinely novel or just a variation of shortest-path techniques.

In summary, Real-Route presents a well-framed concept, but the actual implementation falls short of the real-world complexity and innovation it aims to represent.
project_name: Real-Route

comments:
The project on the Stock Sentiment Prediction System for the Malaysian and USA stock markets is quite impressive and has a solid foundation. Here are some points of feedback:

Pros:
1. Relevance and Utility: The project addresses a pertinent issue by aiming to predict stock market trends, which is valuable for investors, especially new and novice ones.
2. Innovation: Creating a custom market mood index based on MOM or YOY measures showcases creativity and an understanding of market dynamics.
3. Cross-Market Analysis: Focusing on both Malaysian and USA stock markets adds a comparative angle that can be insightful for users.
4. Intelligible Knowledge: The emphasis on making the predictions and insights understandable to novice investors is commendable.

Areas for Improvement:
1. Data Sources and Quality: Elaborate on the data sources used and ensure they are reliable and up-to-date. High-quality data is crucial for accurate predictions.
2. Algorithm Explanation: Provide more details on the algorithms and models used for sentiment analysis and trend prediction. This will help in understanding the robustness of the system.
3. Performance Metrics: Include performance metrics to evaluate the accuracy and reliability of the predictions. This could involve backtesting with historical data and showing the results.

Overall, the project is well-conceived and has the potential to be highly useful. By focusing on the areas of improvement, it can be further refined and enhanced to provide even more value to its users.
project_name: MacroMaster - Stock Sentiment Prediction System

comments:
Your project effectively addresses a highly relevant problem within the tourism industry by tackling information overload and generic recommendations. Your clear articulation of this foundational issue is commendable. For future refinement, consider supporting your problem statement with specific data or user survey insights to further emphasize its significance.

In terms of development, SmartTour impressively integrates a full-stack web application with a hybrid AI recommendation engine, interactive map, and AI chatbot. The inclusion of a novelty score to promote sustainable tourism is a particularly innovative and thoughtful aspect of your solution. To truly push the boundaries of innovation, consider exploring novel data sources, perhaps real-time social media trends or local events, to offer even more dynamic and hyper-personalized recommendations. While the features are robust, clarifying the technical architecture with a detailed diagram explaining component interactions would significantly enhance its perceived technical soundness. Additionally, developing a mobile application of your solution and exploring more scalable database solutions beyond SQLite would bolster the project's practicality for real-world deployment.

The project's potential impacts and benefits are well-defined, focusing on enhancing user experience and fostering sustainable tourism. Your reported performance metrics are encouraging, demonstrating the system's effectiveness. To further strengthen this, detailing the dataset used for training your machine learning models and how the method used for evaluation would add more credibility.

Finally, your pitch was well-structured and delivered with confidence, clearly presenting the project's objectives, features, and business potential. Your ability to convey complex aspects engagingly is a significant strength. To refine your entrepreneurial vision, incorporating a more detailed market analysis that identifies direct competitors and outlines specific user acquisition strategies would provide a clearer path toward pre-commercialization. Overall, your dedication to this project is evident, and SmartTour represents a highly promising solution. Congratulations on your excellent work, and keep innovating!
project_name: SmartTour: Intelligent Tourist Recommendation System

comments:
That's a smart direction to take the ALPR system. Expanding its capabilities to help drivers locate their vehicles—especially in large, complex parking structures like malls—would significantly enhance user convenience. You could integrate features such as:

Location tagging: Automatically mark the last known parking spot using ALPR data and GPS.

Push notifications: Alert vehicle owners in real time about unusual activity, attempted break-ins, or movement detection.

In-app navigation: Guide users back to their vehicle through indoor mapping or augmented reality overlays.

These additions would not only improve usability but also add a layer of safety and value that could make the application stand out commercially. Let me know if you'd like help drafting a proposal section for this enhancement.
project_name: AI-based smart parking system using OpenALPR Algorithm integrated with IOT application

comments:
Project to enhance the Zero Waste Awareness App is a fantastic initiative, especially in broadening the understanding beyond just typical recycling. The Assessment Module with personalized learning, quizzes, and a reward system is a great foundation for engagement, and the Leaderboard will certainly foster healthy competition.

To truly elevate this project and engage users more, consider collaborating with campus authorities or sustainability groups. A challenging point would be, Property guru also provides digital signature through adobe acrobat sign, which is a competitive feature compared with the idea of digital signature in the app.

The upload and signature seemed applicable to rental properties for tenancy agreement, however it only applies partially to new sale and subsale properties, as they involve much complicated process of ownership transfer, agreement (DOA/MOT, SPA, OTP and etc.) 

It would be better to reduce the scope to focus on one of the properties type (rental, new, subsale) and help user streamline the entire process completely to solve the problem better. For instance rental properties, maybe add in communication module with agent, status tracking (property visit schedule, payment transaction, tenancy agreement, etc)

comments:
Overall, this is a promising and practical tool for monitoring security alerts and vulnerabilities. There are several areas where further clarification and technical depth would improve your approach.

While the tool appears to automatically prioritize alerts, the methodology behind this prioritization is not clearly defined. It would be beneficial to elaborate on the logic or algorithmic criteria being used — for example, are you weighing CVSS scores, exploitability metrics, or contextual relevance to the client’s environment?

The source and scope of your vulnerability detection are somewhat ambiguous. Are you leveraging public vulnerability databases such as CVE.org or the NVD (National Vulnerability Database), and if so, how are you integrating that data into your scanning logic? 

It would be helpful to allow this to be integrated into a CI/CD pipeline. A seamless integration with development workflows (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins) could significantly improve developer responsiveness and encourage secure coding practices.
project_name: CyberAir - Automated Incident Response Module for SIEM

comments:
EVENTUSM is a good project with a clearly defined problem statement, great job on setting the foundation!
However, it seems that many key pain points were missed, and the proposed solution could be more user-centric and practical. Currently, the roadmap feels a bit complex to adopt and remember, especially from a real-world usability perspective.
A few suggestions to strengthen the solution:
Think from the user's and stakeholders’ perspective, this will help uncover more relevant challenges and smarter solutions.
For future development, consider building a mobile application to simplify access and usability.
Explore the use of Agentic AI to personalize and streamline the user journey, making the overall experience more effective and engaging.
You’re on the right path, with these improvements, the project can become much more impactful. Keep iterating and evolving!
project_name: Event@campus Management System

This app relies heavily for all bus driver to always start the app each time they started driving, which requires top-down influence involving bus operator and local authorities (University in this example). Problem statement didn't explore why bus was delayed usually.

How would the density calculated properly if not always all bus rider would be using the app? Driver won't have time to update the app once started driving the bus.

There's no way to manage multiple buses and if driver are driving different bus each time.

comments:
This proejct is a well defined and practical SaaS offering that addresses a genuine demand for affordable and available sentiment analysis for e-commerce and small business customers. 

It also provides both traditional and modern NLP approaches which offer great ease for users and a flexible experience, allowing the user to understand the trade offs of legacy machine learning  newer transformer models. 

The web interface enhances usability by allowing users control over input and visualization of results thereby making sentiment analysis not only usable but also user-friendly. As a future improvement, the project would be enhanced through features such as the addition of multilingual support, real-time API availability, as well as more documentation for non-technical users. 

Also, the graphing of sentiment over time or integration with external sites like Twitter (X) and Shopify etc, would greatly increase its business intelligence.  This toolkit provides an excellent tradeoff between technical richness and pragmatic usability, and has great potential for both real-world implementation and classroom instruction.

Great job with overall demonstration.
project_name: Sentiment Analysis Toolkit

comments: Overall, this is a well-thought-out project that successfully delivers the expected features and modules. A quick market check suggests there are no existing apps offering a similar solution specifically for Malaysia, which adds relevance to the work. However, the solution appears to require significant manual effort from clinic administrators; more automation could have been integrated to improve operational efficiency. From an innovation standpoint, the project lacks a strong "wow" factor. For example, instead of pet owners turning to apps like ChatGPT for symptom inquiries, the app could position itself as the first point of contact — capturing early symptom information and passing useful insights to the attending veterinarian. Integrating AI in this way would add value and differentiate the product further.

comments:
Overall, the project concept is good and innovative, and the project presentation is clear and well-delivered.

"Customizable shopping lists" is listed as one of the system objectives, but not demonstrated through the product demo.

It would be good if the scalability concerns of this project are addressed in the presentation, e.g. how to scale it to support various product categories or even shopping sites in terms of training data, web interfaces, product comparison, etc., how well does the database scale to support the increasing amount of product reviews, how to safeguard the "Test Our ABSA Model" functionality from being exploited by malicious users to overload the system, etc. 

The reliance on Apify for scraping the product review data might also affect the ability to productize this solution as it might be subject to huge subscription costs from Apify, hence it will be helpful if there's some form of business analysis on the potential cost components to address this concern.

Well done on tackling a problem in a very difficult space. Helping farmers with data-driven decision making could have a very large impact on the real world. Your solution looks like a good start towards something useful, but I think a lot of practical details are overlooked.  Most of these sensors will need to be out in the fields but I didn't get a sense that you had considered battery, network connectivity (and intermittent unavailability), or environmental protection for them. 

I thought the "I hate you" message is inappropriate for a commercial product.

This project could help farmers across the world and if you manage to create a marketable product that is cost-effective and robust then I believe you could make a very real change to the world. comments:
I am really impressed by the website, choice of CSS and flow management. Choice of icons, padding, colours are impressive. The website has a lot of modules which seems be well engineered and you have the sense of what a good product is!
Feedback: 
1) EventVerse fosters lifelong learning, community-driven education, and easy access to knowledge-sharing events, directly supporting the core goals of SDG 4 but the complexity of the website is designed to cater bigger events than the problem statement. It is a scalable product but I see extra features which needs to be aligned with the scope.

2) The combination of content-based filtering and AI-powered recommendations is a good practice as it will solve major of your location, choice and attracting users. In future you can pick you own AI and train the model as per your need to avoid any unnecessary recommendation.

3) The networking forum adds real value by enabling collaboration, discussion, and shared learning—fostering deeper educational experiences, A way to communicate with different universities which has open events (hackathon, sports) .

4) Features like the announcement section and QR-based check-ins will help more user to use the App and it looks more Solid for a product.
Cons: 
There are other competitors in the market (BMS, Ticket2U etc) which has already grabbed the market and can launch a beta version for your product with minimal cost. Focus or exclusivity and scaling locally.
project_name: EventVerse - An Event Management System

comments:
Flutter App showcases a thoughtful and well structured approach to leading users through their mobile intermittent fasting process. By offering defined fast plans such as 16:8 and 14:10, the app serves the diverse needs and abilities of users. 

The application of machine learning techniques, such as content based filtering for suggested meals and linear regression for predicting weight trends, adds huge value by transforming the app from a timer to a data-driven, smart health assistant. 

The application of Flutter for cross-platform UI, Firebase for real-time data handling, and FastAPI for backend scalability reflects a state of the art and effective tech stack.

To enhance the experience further, it could be beneficial to include features such as habit reminders, hydration tracking, or integration with wearable devices to track more comprehensive health data. 

Adding visual progress dashboards and gamification elements could also help encourage higher levels of engagement and motivation. 

Overall, the app shows a definite intersection of usability, machine learning, and real-time feedback and making it an effective tool in the growing digital wellness space.
project_name: Intermittent Fasting, Diet, and Weight Track System

comments: This project stands out for its technical sophistication, practical application, and well-thought-out design. With a few usability and explainability enhancements, it could be a strong contender for a real-world trading assistant or investor support tool.

comments:
1. AI Recipe Generator (Cuisine Culture)
Ingredient Challenges: Some users may find it challenging to understand recipes based solely on ingredients. Enhancing this with information about the type of cuisine by culture  can improve user experience,

Sentiment Analysis: Analyzing sentiment from comments can be subjective. Using star ratings initially is a good approach. Eventually, integrating sentiment analysis into generative recipes could be considered, keeping in mind the complexities of subjective opinions.

Homepage and Logo: Improving the homepage with a logo that has a transparent background can enhance visual appeal and professionalism.

Detailed Instructions: Implementing an auto-scroll view for detailed instructions can ensure users can easily read long, static content without truncation.

2. Product with Multiple Algorithms 
Nutritional Analysis: Using algorithms like Euclidean distance for nutritional analysis is useful but needs to consider factors beyond just weight and height. Factors like Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR), medical conditions, and dietary restrictions should also be incorporated for accurate results.

User Interface: Implementing scroll views or frame layouts for detailed pictures can improve user interaction, allowing users to explore content without missing any details.

Technical Implementation: Utilizing resources like the example on Stack Overflow for resizing ImageView within ScrollView can enhance the technical aspects of the product.

User Engagement: Ensuring users can seamlessly explore detailed content they scroll through is crucial for user satisfaction and engagement.

3. Overall Application
Overall, your ideas indicate a strong focus on improving user experience, integrating advanced features like sentiment analysis gradually, and ensuring nutritional and health-related functionalities are robust and accurate. Continuous improvement based on user feedback and technological advancements will certainly make your application valuable and useful to a broader audience interested in fitness and health.

If you need further detailed advice on any specific aspect or want to delve deeper into implementation strategies, feel free to ask!
project_name: EzCook (Food Recipe Builder and Recommendation)

comments:
NutriSense is a great example of a well innovative and technology driven product in the digital nutrition and health category. Its application of deep learning for instant recognition of fruits and vegetables to address the issue of manual input, a significant issue in food logging, increases the users' convenience significantly. 

The tiered process of not just recognizing food, but also enriching it with personalized dietary guidance based on the health of the individual makes the app both intelligent and creating health awareness. The simplicity of use of the dashboard UI further enhances functionality by allowing users to view nutritional data and track progress in an easily digestible format, which is integral for long-term adherence and compliance with diet goals.

I would like to suggest some improvements such as you might add analysis of meal makeup  and such as meal breakdown and OCR capabilities to translate food packaging. Adding integration with wearables or electronic health records  might allow for more condition conscious, dynamic suggestions, too.

I believe NutriSense presents a great blend of AI, personalization, and user centric design, and it is a highly appealing solution for active nutrition and healthcare management.
project_name: AI-Based Fruit and Vegetable Recognition for Nutritional and Vitamin Information

comments:
Your project is feature-rich and has the potential to become a significant player in this niche market. With a clear focus and a reliable, powerful development team, you can further enhance and market this project successfully. Here are some considerations for your project's roadmap:
1. Project Scaling
- Suggestion: Given the diverse features (chatbot, pricing and info, mechanic locator, discussion forum), consider separating each feature into independent services.
- Benefit: Adopting a microservices architecture allows each feature to scale independently and be maintained more efficiently. For example, use MongoDB to store chatbot interaction history, ElasticSearch for storing pricing and information, and PostgreSQL for the discussion forum. This separation ensures better performance and scalability.

2. Reliable Web Framework:
- Suggestion: Utilize a robust web framework capable of handling high traffic and ensuring reliability in a production environment.
- Benefit: Frameworks like Laravel (PHP), Fiber/Echo/Gin (Go), or Django (Python) are known for their reliability and performance in production settings. Choosing a proven framework can help manage large-scale applications effectively.

3. Production-Ready Configuration:
- Suggestion: Avoid using default configurations when preparing for production deployment.
- Benefit: Default configurations are typically suited for development environments and may not provide the necessary security and performance optimizations required for production. Ensure you configure your application for security, performance, and scalability specific to production needs.

4. Log Metrics:
- Suggestion: Implement comprehensive logging and monitoring metrics.
- Benefit: Logging metrics are crucial for identifying issues, monitoring performance, and ensuring the smooth operation of your application in a production environment. Tools like ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), Prometheus, and Grafana can help in collecting and visualizing these metrics effectively.

By following these recommendations, you can ensure that your project is well-prepared for growth, maintains high performance, and is ready for market deployment. Excellent work on your project so far, and I look forward to seeing its future success!

comments:
Thank you for sharing your project with us. I liked that you chose to use the "talking head" style as it gives a positive first impression and helps to retain engagement. The use of your "reaction pic" in the thumbnail is an effective way to pique user interest and is used a lot by influencers - well done for including it.

I think that your choice of tech was good.  Your presentation missed the opportunity to highlight the positive aspects of using it. For example, you will be able to deploy to iOS and Android using the same codebase which reduces the cost of development and maintenance.

Did you consider using Redis to manage the leaderboard? It has a very simple mechanism that lets you do this with minimal effort.

Your architecture diagram makes it look like you're connecting the application directly to the database. Where would you implement load balancing and caches?

How about using AI to detect if an image is inappropriate when a user uploads it? It would be better to have some sort of pre-screening in place to prevent bad actors from uploading bad images.  If you wait for a report then you need to hire moderators and also the post will be visible to users for a while. This has an impact on UX (seeing bad images) and entrepreneurship (salary costs) that I think you could have discussed.

You did not mention security and privacy. I think you should protect your users and at least mention that you've considered these issues.

comments:
EchoMind is a comprehensive virtual mental health platform developed to support university students in managing their emotional well-being. It combines a range of features—including real-time emotion detection via facial recognition, a 24/7 Mental Health Virtual Assistant (MHVA) chatbot, a counseling booking system, and curated self-help resources such as guided meditation, music, and articles. The project presents itself as a holistic and inclusive mental health ecosystem designed to reduce stigma and promote accessible mental wellness support.

The project demonstrates strong social relevance and commendable intent. Mental health is a pressing concern among students, and EchoMind addresses this with empathy and thoughtful design. The inclusion of emotion detection technology adds a layer of personalization, while the MHVA chatbot extends the app’s utility beyond office hours, making it potentially more approachable than traditional support systems.

From a technical perspective, the combination of facial recognition and chatbot functionality presents moderate complexity. However, it’s important to note that these technologies are not novel on their own; their value lies in thoughtful integration and ethical application. The project would be strengthened by clear validation of the emotion detection’s accuracy, privacy safeguards for sensitive data, and actual user feedback to assess usability and trust.

Overall, EchoMind is a well-scoped, meaningful solution with strong potential for real-world use. It balances usability, empathy, and technology effectively, though innovation largely stems from integration rather than novel development.
project_name: EchoMind: A Mental Health Application

comments: The project’s problem statement and scope exhibit commendable clarity, providing a solid foundation. However, the solution’s intricacies remain elusive. Specifically, the distinction between default and custom models requires elucidation. How will doctors access or curate a custom dataset for training? Addressing this critical data requirement is paramount. Furthermore, the decision to employ multiple models rather than a unified approach warrants clarification. While innovation is laudable, practicality must not be overlooked. A more explicit articulation of the project’s purpose would enhance overall coherence and engagement. Balancing novelty with feasibility is crucial for success

comments:
I think that this solution is needed in current time and era. The existing chatbot technologies are very modest and poor in providing the most desired results for a business, that is Customer Engagement. This should be the main keyword of the Problem statement, and I didn't see it in the presentation. I think Muhammad has to rethink the problem statement delivery, in order to really address the problems that real world users need to be solved. Then, the solution has to be tied in strongly to customer engagement and successful sales. 

I think there is still plenty of room for Innovativeness, such as the use of AI to generate data set within the backend of the dashboard, features like drag and drop logic for questions and answers for the chatbot, libraries of questions and answers, personalization of the human voice to target specific customers based on age, geographical location, occupation, language, lifestyle, etc. 

As for the presentation structure, it should consist of a little bit of yourself and anything that ties you to the problem to show your expertise or experience, then pains that are being solved which in this case is actually Customer Engagement to lead to purchases, then show some current conditions and some real figures to show the demand to this solution, then finally the Go to market plan and show how it can be successful with some projection sales figures. 

Remember to also EMPHASIZE the benefits that the chatbot users will get, the business owners. Free package should include all features but with limitations.

The presenter's emotion and excitement, can really do good to what you are presenting. And finally, I think this is one of the most needed solutions to be presented out there now, as we enter the AI-dominated world.

comments:
Problem Statement:
1.	The high costs of MANET simulators and test beds were missed.
2.	Expand on test bed capabilities for running 3rd party applications.
3.	The final point is the lack of NaaS in the marketplace. Develop, test, and deploy.
Development:
1.	Encryption is missing in motion as well as at rest in simulators and test beds, especially if converted to a NaaS offering.
2.	The dashboard showing the real-time position of the MANET nodes is missing, which is essential for a large-scale deployment.
3.	The authentication process should expand on possible areas of improvement in MFA and SSO.
Pitching
1.	The content is good, but it needs to be placed differently.
2.	The transition from a Testbed to a full product needs more information for all investors.
3.	Good presentation skills, slow and clear outline content.
4.	Good integration of open-source solutions. What would the architecture be for large Test Beds or production environments?
5.	I assume it is loosely coupled so elements can be interchanged if going to a production environment.

Entrepreneurship:
The global Wireless Ad Hoc Network Market size was $647.50 Million in 2022 & is projected to grow $1078.17 Million by 2030, at a CAGR of 8.87% during the forecast period 2024 - 2030. The increasing adoption of IoT devices across various industries, including healthcare, manufacturing, transportation, and smart cities, is driving the demand for wireless ad hoc networks. 
1.	MANET, as NaaS, could interest organisations looking for rapid development and testing.
2.	The transition from a test bed to a full production environment should be more clearly outlined.
3.	What are the leading competitors, and what makes your solution the best choice?
4.	What is missing is the low cost of the solution, hardware, software, and integration.
5.	Although markets were outlined in the presentation, their size is missing in USD.

comments:
You've identified a widespread issue for online shoppers, skillfully articulating the challenges of unstructured reviews. This clear problem definition establishes an excellent foundation. The engineered solution, which uses Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis (ABSA), is conceptually strong, with a well-designed modular architecture and intelligent components such as SetFit and Gemini. However, more information on ABSA model training data, its applicability to various types of products, and your specific ABSA implementation is required. Practically, the design is unclear regarding scaling for large user bases or e-commerce integration. I recommend providing these explicit details and incorporating scalability into your design.

Your solution stands out for its innovativeness, providing granular, aspect-specific insights through SetFit ABSA and Gemini integration, as well as its continuous learning mechanism. This has significant implications for consumers and businesses. To make these more compelling, quantify potential gains such as time savings or increased conversion rates.

Your pitch was exceptionally well-structured and clear, with a smooth live demonstration. However, the background music was excessively loud, interfering with your verbal delivery. For future pitches, make sure the audio levels are optimal to enhance your delivery.

Your entrepreneurial vision is admirable, with innovative monetization strategies such as the browser extension and API platform that are perfectly aligned with market opportunities. To strengthen this, create a more detailed go-to-market strategy that includes acquisition tactics and a comprehensive pricing model.

Overall, your dedication is evident, and SELEK has good potential and real-world impact. Congratulations on your excellent work, and keep your innovative work going!
project_name: Sentiment-Based Smart Shopping Assistant

comments:
Your project, VR Scaffold Designer, showcases an impressive use of virtual reality technology to innovate scaffold design in the construction industry. Leveraging the Unity engine, GLTF plugin, VRIF framework, and PICO4 technology, you have created an immersive and interactive environment that enhances the precision and efficiency of scaffold design. Here are some pros and areas for improvement:

Pros:
1. Immersive Environment: Utilizing advanced VR technology provides an engaging and realistic environment for users to design scaffolds, which can significantly improve the accuracy and usability of the designs.
2. Real-Time Distance Calculation: The inclusion of real-time distance calculation between components helps in creating precise scaffold models, ensuring better fit and safety in real-world applications.
3. Component Usage Tracking: A tracking system for component usage aids in efficient resource management, helping users keep track of materials and optimize their usage.

Areas for Improvement:
1. User Documentation: Providing detailed and user-friendly documentation is essential. Ensure the documentation includes comprehensive installation guides, usage instructions, and troubleshooting tips to help users get the most out of the system.
2. Performance Optimization: Consider optimizing the system's performance to handle large and complex scaffold models more efficiently. This will enhance the user experience, especially during intensive design sessions.
3. User Interface: Improving the user interface to be more intuitive and user-friendly can significantly enhance the overall user experience. Focus on making navigation and interaction smoother, particularly for users who may not be familiar with VR technology.

Overall, VR Scaffold Designer is a promising project with valuable innovations for scaffold design. By addressing these areas for improvement, you can further enhance its functionality and impact.
project_name: VR Scaffold Designer

comments:
Your project does a great job of identifying a major problem with managing medications, showing that you really understand what patients need. The story of "Uncle Rashid" does a great job of showing how hard it is for older people to keep track of all their medications. DrugMate's modular design and the use of an LLM with OCR capabilities are approperiate for solving such a difficult problem. To make the solution more technically sound, it is important to provide a detailed explanation of how you fine-tuned or prompt the Gemini Flash model and, most importantly, to describe a method for checking the accuracy and reliability of its medical outputs. You should also justify why you chose to use Gemini and MongoDB instead of other options. 

The OCR-assisted drug interaction checker is a good idea, but its unique selling point needs to be made clearer. Think about demonstrating how DrugMate's implementation is more accurate, reliable, or easy to use with certified medical databases than a free general-purpose LLM. Additionally, for the solution to be ready for real-world use, it needs to handle concerns about regulatory compliance, data privacy, and scalability to a large number of users.

Your well-structured business model demonstrates your innovative approach to entering the market. However, the entrepreneurial opportunity is notably constrained by the absence of a truly defensible unique selling point against free LLMs and, more critically, by the unaddressed practical and regulatory challenges. To make DrugMate a useful and commercially viable solution in the healthcare field, it will be important to successfully address these key technical and operational issues.

Your dedication to this vital area is clearly demonstrated, and your passion for addressing medication safety challenges is commendable. I strongly encourage you to continue developing your innovative solution.
project_name: DrugMate: An LLM-based chatbot for drugs safety and adverse reactions

comments:
Problem statements are somewhat unappealing, don't seem to be real world issues. A more valid and impactful framing for the problem could have been: retailers struggle to manage inventory (stock) due high number of SKUs

Low attention to detail, typos and grammar mistakes - although English is not his native tongue, could have used some help to double check first the slides and content in general. 

The student limited himself to read the slides, hard to comment about his presentation skills.

The solution is somewhat simple and the elements highlighted aren't innovative enough, mentioning SQLAlchemy which is an ORM library in a project like this speaks of certain technical limitations.

He did a decent job during the demo, however the video ended abruptly.

There is no mention about the commercial opportunity for a project like this nor any extensions/description about the potential of bringing a solution like this to the market.
project_name: Merchandise Recognition System in Retail Industry

comments:
I'm currently planning my next holiday vacation trip, and in fact I share the same problems stated by this project (no weather, recommended places, my travel history, ...), however I would expect more in the problem statement to make it more impactful, by giving examples or numbers.

The presentation goes to quickly in the technical topics, and is less "user-oriented".
For the technical presentation (tech stack, architecture), I would prefer to just have an overview of the architecture (with a diagram).

For the entrepreneurship opportunity, it's here presented as "monetization strategy" which is a different than entrepreneurship; again it's more technical than user oriented, or even business oriented. And I would suggest to present the pricing model/offerings at the end, not right after the tech stack.

Login/Registration shouldn't be a focus in the presentation, in the architecture, or in the demo. It's a basic features, no one cares about Login, we should only focus on the main features of this project.

The website itself seems not enough user friendly, the presenter has to explain some parts via the demo (e.g., the meaning of colors of recommended spots).

I liked the part where there are also suggestion of other sites near the travel spot, based on the user's history of travel places.
However, for recommendation based on the other users ratings, I'm wondering how to maintain a reviews/ratings data base; why users would rate/review spots in this tool, while they are already doing it in websites like Google/TripAdvisor.
I would prefer to focus on the recommendation engine, rather than in the ratings/reviews (by getting these ones from external partners).

I don't see the real advantage of the chatbot, (need to ask the weather for every city one by one). Why not directly give the weather of locations when planning the trip?
project_name: SmartTour: Intelligent Tourist Recommendation System

comments:
hat’s a valuable and insightful observation. While mobile phone-based data capture may work in controlled or dry environments, it's clearly impractical in wet, industrial settings like shrimp processing facilities. To unlock real potential, the solution could evolve in the following ways:

Industrial Integration: Adapt the system for deployment on high-speed sorting machines, using waterproof, industrial-grade cameras that can handle the harsh conditions.

Real-time Processing: Leverage edge computing to perform fast image analysis on-site, minimising latency and reducing dependence on manual oversight.

Hands-Free Operation: Implement fully automated data capture and classification to maintain productivity without requiring workers to engage with mobile devices.

By shifting toward an industrial-scale solution, the project could dramatically expand its relevance and commercial viability across seafood, agriculture, and broader manufacturing sectors.
project_name: Udang Checker: A Mobile Application Shrimp Freshness Detection Using Deep Learning

comments:
I appreciate the effort that went into this project, especially tackling the complexities of managing both monetary and non-monetary loans. However, I do have some concerns about the feasibility of certain features. For instance, the auto-deduction mechanism raises questions—typically, for such a function to work, the system would need to interface with real financial accounts, which would require integration with a payment gateway. As far as I could see, this critical component wasn’t mentioned, so it’s difficult to assess how the feature would operate in a real-world setting.

Additionally, any system handling real money is likely subject to regulatory and licensing requirements, which are important considerations in the planning and design stage. I didn’t see these issues addressed in the project, which makes it hard to evaluate the solution from a real-world implementation perspective.

That said, I do acknowledge the work that’s been done. If you feel my assessment hasn’t fairly reflected your efforts, I encourage you to reach out to your lecturer for a review.

comments: Your project description provides a comprehensive overview of the BPMS, effectively highlighting its key features and the significant benefits it offers to SMEs. The emphasis on user-friendly design, seamless integration, and adaptability through AGILE methodology clearly demonstrates the system's potential to improve business data management and operational efficiency. Additionally, the focus on future enhancements shows a commitment to ongoing development and responsiveness to user needs, which is crucial for maintaining relevance in dynamic business environments. comments:
The Intelligent Stock Analysis and Prediction System is a full-featured web platform designed to assist investors in stock market forecasting, technical analysis, and risk assessment. It integrates a range of machine learning and deep learning models—LSTM, Attention-LSTM, GRU, Transformer, and ARIMA—alongside technical indicators (e.g., MA, RSI, ATR), sentiment analysis, and financial risk metrics (e.g., Sharpe ratio, volatility, drawdown, Beta).

Built with Flask, Pandas, and NumPy on the backend, and developed with HTML5, JavaScript, and ECharts on the frontend, the project demonstrates strong technical competency and full-stack development capability. The dashboard offers a clean, interactive interface with real-time charts and multi-model predictions.

However, despite its completeness, this system is not innovative. Similar stock analysis platforms—with real-time charts, AI-based prediction models, and sentiment dashboards—are already widespread in both academic demos and commercial tools (e.g., TradingView, Yahoo Finance with ML plugins, and numerous GitHub repositories). The models used are well-established and not tailored in any novel way. There is no unique insight, strategy, or feature that sets this project apart from what already exists in the market.

In short, this is a well-executed replication and integration of existing methods into a unified platform, suitable for academic demonstration but lacking originality or standout innovation.
project_name: Stock Price Prediction System

comments:
Thank you for your presentation. It is a clear productivity gain if this problem statement can be resolved, so thank you for working on this solution. However, currently the solution hasn't fully meet the potential as the main value of the automation is to drive a drop in test time reduction, automate running the bulk of the tests, test result management and more. You can also show the impact of your tool by showing the real work results such as % test time reduction or statistics of how long these tests usually take the developer.  To be clear, you don't have to broadly solve all use-cases out there. It is sufficient pick a few common use cases and make a large enough improvement to those (e.g. smaller set of user base, but if the value is there, users will adopt the tools).

Keep up the great work and thank you for your presentation !
project_name: Security Penetration Tool for Mobile Application

comments:
Problem Statement
Current product reviews in Malaysia feature mixed languages, which traditional tools cannot process, leading to inaccurate insights for business owners.
There is a lack of in-depth supporting research to demonstrate the significance and scope of the problem.

Solution
Provides clear visualization to show trends of positive and negative reviews.
Suggests that trend charts over time should display all months on the x-axis, even if there is no data for certain months.
Consider to include negative review as example in your csv file. Include review that has mixed language (as you mentioned in your problem statement, Bahasa Rojak).
For "collect code-mixed product reviews from websites", yes, you took Lazada as example.
For "determine and implement optimal model for classifying sentiment accurately", no proper example show to compare, and how to choose which model is suitable, and why.
For "user-friendly sentiment analytics dashboard", yes, you have bar chart and trend chart, and data can be export to csv file, very comprehensive.

Impacts & Benefits
Will assist online business owners by providing accurate sentiment analysis.

Practicality
Current design requires users to manually copy and paste links or upload CSV files for analysis, would suggest automating the process to reflect real-time data to business owners.

Content and Clarity
Presentation slides are clear and easy to understand.
Consistent design and theme, with animations and transitions between slides. It is fluent.
Recommends using easy-to-read fonts like Calibri, Arial, and Gill Sans.
Advises ensuring screenshot font sizes match body content font sizes for readability, or rebuilding content in PowerPoint if font is too small.

Presentation Skills
Presenter has good attire and outlook, with welcoming facial expressions and gestures.
Advises avoiding the use of "so" at the beginning of every sentence.
project_name: SENTIMENT ANALYTICS PLATFORM FOR CODE MIXED ENGLISH MALAY PRODUCT REVIEW

Without insight into the tech stack or infrastructure, it’s difficult to assess whether the proposed monthly subscription fee is justifiable. From my perspective, the pricing seems too steep for widespread adoption in educational institutions, especially considering existing budget constraints.

As a software engineer, I’d also recommend rethinking the delivery model. Rather than releasing this as a standalone app, it might be more strategic to develop it as a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution. This would allow the core attendance-tracking feature to be integrated into platforms that institutions are already using, avoiding redundancy and improving scalability. Positioning it as a feature that complements existing systems—rather than replicating them—could make the offering more attractive and sustainable.

comments:
Good overall effort. Some areas for consideration:
1) The name - Pieces - consider that sometimes, the term may denote 'falling apart', 'coming unglued'. Avoid negative implications in your brand name

2) Reconsider the positioning of the solution - mental health issues are a complex and vast area - a solution that positions itself to tackle this may prove infeasible. Consider repositioning as a 'Life Coach' - helping users to achieve their peak performance in studying, working, and achieving their goals. Elements of mental/emotional state can still be covered as something complementary 

3) While the potential for GenAI to help with providing a natural supportive interactive tool remains huge, there are concerns around limiting users' interaction with other humans further (a very real issue in mental health challenges) - consider having the tool encourage users to set up a call list of friends and family so that chatbot can consistently encourage users to reach out and talk to others. Prompt with 'when was the last time you had an encouraging conversation with ....". 

4) There are also concerns around GenAI tools feeding into the fears and conspiracy thinking of some users - some behaviors of these LLM models cannot be adequately predicted for user safety, especially those with mental health challenges.

I am excited to read the problem statement (PS) for every project that I evaluate, including this one.

I hoped that the keyword "intelligent document search and classification" would be addressed in the demo. Unfortunately, it was not.

What I saw was common file storage with manual labeling and workflows for adding, modifying, and deleting files—nothing more.

Good luck.
project_name: Intelligent Document Search and Classification

comments:
This project presents a commendable initiative to convert unstructured, real-time web data into structured insights for disaster response. The integration of web scraping, rule-based NLP, and a React Native mobile interface demonstrates a good understanding of cross-technology workflows. The classification of messages into Emergency, Alert, and Non-Emergency categories offers a foundational layer for prioritization, and the JSON-structured output is appropriate for downstream usage and API exposure.

However, reliance on external web sources such as NADMA, Buletin Mutiara, and JPS raises concerns about data reliability, format inconsistency, and long-term scalability. Web scraping is fragile—subject to layout changes, network latency, and legal issues. As the project scales nationwide, latency and server load will increase. Therefore, the system must adopt a hybrid architecture: scrape + ingest authoritative APIs (where possible), store the data in a NoSQL or time-series database, and use asynchronous queue-based systems (e.g., RabbitMQ or Pub/Sub) with caching (e.g., Redis) for real-time response. An architecture diagram is essential to communicate this flow.

The use of OCR (e.g., Tesseract) is a smart inclusion, but its application needs clearer demonstration. OCR alone is not enough—optical data should pass through a pre-trained lightweight LLM (e.g., DistilBERT) for better context extraction (hazard type, location, urgency). You may also integrate image classification models (e.g., MobileNet or EfficientNet) to detect floods or fires directly from social media images. These AI layers enhance both precision and automation.

UI/UX requires refinement—spacing, alignment, color consistency, and control types (e.g., using dropdowns instead of text boxes) should follow Material Design principles. Tools like Figma can guide design consistency.

Lastly, focus on specific hazards (e.g., floods or wildfires) for Phase 1 deployment, enabling structured adoption before expanding scope.
project_name: CrisisRelay: Crowdsourced Information System for Disaster​

comments:

This is a great project with lots of potential to improve. Keep up the good work!
project_name: SmartStock

comments:
It would improve usability if every primary key in the grid linked to a detail view, e.g., F0001 *+(with hyperlink for detailed popup), as it's hard to recall who/what F0001/INV0001 represents.

Implementing role-based access control (RBAC) is essential. It clarifies who manages what—like controlling inventory—or assigning new users to system roles. Currently, anyone can edit data without accountability.

I'm unsure how ALNS functions here—for instance, how it assigns allocations. If it uses an algorithm, clarify its variables and outcomes per use case. Adaptability suggests adjusting based on stock and requirements, which needs clearer explanation in the presentation deck (so far is blackbox)

Simplify the user interface, especially for managing inventory and allocations on separate pages(or popup) Current UI complexity may confuse less tech-savvy users.

Ensure consistency in allocation rules. Monthly household income influencing allocations should be clearly communicated. Prevent unintended edits during sessions, maintaining system integrity.

Enforce atomicity—no deletions, only soft deletes. Utilize expired item alerts effectively, possibly enhancing with nightly email reminders/reports.

Inventory adjustments need constraints on who can modify and how—consider storage implications. Why are new allocations detached from storage? Clarify allocation logic—by stock, user behavior, or household income? Current clarity is lacking.

Overall, streamline UX for non-technical users. Primary keys like product no., family no., and inventory no. should link to detailed pop-ups. Ensure system updates comprehensive packing in storage management. Consider meaningful names for package.family.allocation keys, expanding beyond three primary keys in one page(big no no ). Implement pagination and date search for inventory and package history for improved functionality would be sufficient to help user track the log.

From a technological standpoint, I find everything to be satisfactory and professionally executed. However, my current concern a niche market that may find some aspects overly sophisticated. While having advanced algorithms is advantageous, I would appreciate a clearer explanation or a layman's terms description in the product guide detailing when dairy nutritional scenarios would be implemented. This clarification would greatly assist in understanding its practical application within this specialized field.
project_name: ReAlloc - A Web-based Optimized Food Allocation System using Adaptive Heuristics

comments:
EvacPath seems to be a well designed and socially relevant project that showcases the ideal combination of artificial intelligence, geospatial mapping, and public action with a view to increasing disaster preparedness in Gelugor, Penang. 

Using  optimizer for evacuation routes with hybrid Genetic Algorithm–Simulated Annealing is technically impressive and designed to dynamic and dynamic disaster contexts. 

Making use of the Google Maps API for real-time spatial accuracy offers real-world utility, and modular construction with evacuation, warning, and reporting capabilities and is building a consolidated disaster response environment. 

Two-way communication between individuals and authorities enabled by the Report Module is particularly stunning and representative of a solid user-centered design.

To further augment the platform, add historical disaster data based predictive analytics to give early warnings and simulation features for community exercises.

Enhancing offline capacity would be beneficial for low coverage or power failure scenarios. In addition to that, expanding the language interface to accommodate local dialects or Bahasa Malaysia would enhance accessibility and uptake.In all, EvacPath is well-suited to SDG 13.1 and is a scalable, AI-powered model for community disaster resilience.
project_name: EvacPath: Path Planning During Natural Disaster

comments:
Dear Looi Wei En,

Congratulations on your project presentation. EventConnect is a promising idea, especially given the growing need for streamlined tech event discovery and networking opportunities. Your efforts are appreciated, and I wish you continued success in your journey!

Here are some suggestions to enhance your work:

Presentation Clarity:
Consider reducing less relevant content during your presentation and focus more on the core features and value of your product. Deliver key points clearly and slowly, ensuring your audience can follow and fully grasp your message.

Modern Enhancements:
Modern platforms benefit greatly from AI integration. I recommend exploring the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) to suggest relevant events to users based on their interests or professional profiles.

Competitor Comparison:
When referencing existing tools like Meetup, ensure your message is objective, clear, and constructive. Rather than simply calling them disappointing, highlight their limitations and show how EventConnect provides a better user experience.

Accessibility Standards:
A great product should be usable by all. Please explore the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) by W3C to make your platform more inclusive: W3C WCAG Guidelines

Overall, you’ve laid a strong foundation for an impactful platform. With continued improvements in delivery, technical implementation, and user-centric design, EventConnect can grow into a truly valuable tool for the tech community.

Keep up the great work and continue exploring innovative ideas!

Best regards,
Thiru
project_name: EventConnect

comments:
Problem Statement:
1.	 Clear and concise statement.
2.	Value adds are clearly explained.
3.	Objectives clearly defined.
Development:
1.	LoRa networks are a good choice compared with NB-IoT Cell-Based LPWAN technology. That said, the coverage is more consistent. The downside is the cost of the license.
2.	The stack combination is good and has been adopted in similar scenarios. It is a scalable stack that says the best infrastructure to support it would be the cloud from prototype to production.
3.	Google Maps has some issues with precision, coverage, and traffic alerts; the second issue with Google Maps is the license costs. 
4.	 This stack combination is a comprehensive solution for building IoT applications.

Pitching
1.	Smooth content delivery.
2.	The pace is near perfection.
3.	The content perfectly follows the idea and the used case.
4.	The presentation contains the right amount of information for the reader to assimilate.
5.	In all good pitch, slowly drive the audience to the right conclusion.
 
Entrepreneurship:
The global LoRa and LoRaWan IoT market size is projected to grow from USD 8.0 billion in 2024 to USD 33.7 billion by 2029 a CAGR of 32.4%. 
The market potential goes beyond what has been presented. Smart cities, Industrial IoT, Agriculture, Geo-tracking mobile object movements like equipment, pallets, and machines. Tracking the movement of shipments for infrastructure networks and systems. Asset protection, as well as optimization via route optimizations. The number of applications is endless. The market in this sector is young and requires an innovative approach and good use of open-source technologies.
project_name: USM On Campus Bus Service Real-Time Tracking Using LoRaWAN Technology
